str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Babylon, the capitol of Chaldaea (as a type of tyranny).
Fellow-elect, fellow-chosen. From a compound of sun and eklegomai; chosen in company with, i.e. Co-elect.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian.
